NOTES

笔记

Introduction

介绍

  • “by the depth of our answers”: Carl Sagan, Cosmos (New York: Random House, 1980), 193.
    “取决于我们答案的深度”：卡尔·萨根，《宇宙》（纽约：兰登书屋，1980 年），第 193 页。
  • only 7 percent of people ask good questions: Leigh Thompson, The Mind and Heart of the Negotiator (New Jersey: Pearson/Prentice Hall, 2005), 77.
    只有 7% 的人会问好问题：Leigh Thompson，《谈判者的思想和心灵》（新泽西州：Pearson/Prentice Hall，2005 年），第 77 页。
  • you not only miss the chance: Ibid.
    你不仅错失了机会：同上。
  • in a business or political situation: “Negotiation,” Macmillan Dictionary , October 2, 2019, https://www.macmillandictionary.com/us/dictionary/american/negotiation#targetText=formaldiscussionsinwhichpeople,contractnegotiations .
    在商业或政治情境中：“谈判”，麦克米伦词典，2019 年 10 月 2 日，https://www.macmillandictionary.com/us/dictionary/american/negotiation#targetText=formaldiscussionsinwhichpeople,contractnegotiations。
  • try to reach an agreement: “Negotiation,” Collins English Dictionary , October 2, 2019, https://www.collinsdictionary.com/us/dictionary/english/negotiation .
    尝试达成协议：“谈判”，柯林斯英语词典，2019 年 10 月 2 日，https://www.collinsdictionary.com/us/dictionary/english/negotiation。
  • research on negotiation and leadership: Tasha Eurich, Insight: The Surprising Truth About How Others See Us, How We See Ourselves, and Why the Answers Matter More Than We Think (New York: Random House, 2017), 99–101; Thompson, 77.
    关于谈判和领导力的研究：Tasha Eurich，《洞察力：关于别人如何看待我们、我们如何看待自己以及为什么答案比我们想象的更重要的惊人真相》（纽约：兰登书屋，2017 年），99-101 页；Thompson，77 页。
  • Studies of the political and social climate: James E. Campbell, Polarized: Making Sense of a Divided America (2016), 31; John Sides & Daniel J. Hopkins, Political Polarization in American Politics (2015), 23.
    政治和社会气候研究：James E. Campbell，《极化：理解分裂的美国》（2016 年），第 31 页；John Sides 和 Daniel J. Hopkins，《美国政治中的政治极化》（2015 年），第 23 页。
  • Research also demonstrates: Wendy L. Bedwell, Stephen M. Fiore & Eduardo Salas, “Developing the Future Workforce: An Approach for Integrating Interpersonal Skills Into the MBA Classroom,” Academy of Management Learning and Communication 13, no. 2 (2013): 172.
    研究还表明：Wendy L. Bedwell、Stephen M. Fiore 和 Eduardo Salas，“培养未来劳动力：将人际交往技能融入 MBA 课堂的方法”，《管理学会学习与沟通》13，第 2 期（2013 年）：172。
#↩

Part 1: The Mirror

第一部分：镜子

  • finds a decided link: Tasha Eurich, Insight: The Surprising Truth About How Others See Us, How We See Ourselves, and Why the Answers Matter More Than We Think (New York: Random House, 2017), 154.
    找到了一个确凿的联系：Tasha Eurich，《洞察力：关于别人如何看待我们、我们如何看待自己以及为什么答案比我们想象的更重要的惊人真相》（纽约：兰登书屋，2017 年），第 154 页。
  • two different kinds of self-awareness: Ibid, 8.
    两种不同的自我意识：同上，第 8 页。
  • Internal self-awareness: Ibid.
    内在自我意识：同上。
  • External self-awareness: Ibid.
    外部自我意识：同上。
  • high external self-awareness but low internal self-awareness: Ibid.
    外部自我意识强，但内部自我意识弱：同上。
  • worked on discovering how to increase self-awareness: Ibid, 11–13
    致力于探索如何提高自我意识：同上，11-13页
  • accurate introspection depends on our asking: Ibid, 101.
    准确的内省取决于我们的提问：同上，101。
  • exactly the wrong questions: Ibid, 98–102.
    完全错误的问题：同上，98-102。
  • the question hanging heaviest: Karen Zraick & David Scull, “Las Vegas, Puerto Rico, Tom Petty: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing,” New York Times , October 3, 2017, https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/03/briefing/las-vegas-donald-trump-puerto-rico-tom-petty.html .
    最令人担忧的问题：Karen Zraick 和 David Scull，“拉斯维加斯、波多黎各、汤姆·佩蒂：您的周二晚间简报”，《纽约时报》，2017 年 10 月 3 日，https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/03/briefing/las-vegas-donald-trump-puerto-rico-tom-petty.html。
  • obtain higher levels of internal self-awareness: Eurich, 100.
    获得更高水平的内在自我意识：Eurich，100。
  • proven to help us remember things better: “Study Focuses on Strategies for Achieving Goals, Resolutions,” Dominican University of California, October 2, 2019, https://www.dominican.edu/dominicannews/study-highlights-strategies-for-achieving-goals .
    已被证明有助于我们更好地记住事物：“研究重点关注实现目标和决心的策略”，加州多米尼加大学，2019 年 10 月 2 日，https://www.dominican.edu/dominicannews/study-highlights-strategies-for-achieving-goals。
  • more likely to achieve them: Mark Murphy, “Neuroscience Explains Why You Need to Write Down Your Goals if You Actually Want to Achieve Them,” Forbes , April 15, 2018, https://www.forbes.com/sites/markmurphy/2018/04/15/neuroscience-explains-why-you-need-to-write-down-your-goals-if-you-actually-want-to-achieve-them/#40a5f44e7905 .
    更有可能实现它们：Mark Murphy，“神经科学解释了为什么如果你真的想实现目标，就需要写下你的目标”，福布斯，2018 年 4 月 15 日，https://www.forbes.com/sites/markmurphy/2018/04/15/neuroscience-explains-why-you-need-to-write-down-your-goals-if-you-actually-want-to-achieve-them/#40a5f44e7905。

One: What’s the Problem I Want to Solve?

第一：我想解决什么问题？

  • five minutes thinking about solutions: Erika Andersen, “Start the New Year Like Albert Einstein,” Forbes , December 20, 2011, https://www.forbes.com/sites/erikaandersen/2011/12/30/start-the-new-year-like-albert-einstein/#6f3d58dd3e12 .
    五分钟思考解决方案：Erika Andersen，“像阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦一样开始新的一年”，《福布斯》，2011 年 12 月 20 日，https://www.forbes.com/sites/erikaandersen/2011/12/30/start-the-new-year-like-albert-einstein/#6f3d58dd3e12。
  • fresh off the success of the iPod, watched: Fred Vogelstein, “The Untold Story: How the iPhone Blew Up the Wireless Industry,” Wired , January 9, 2008, https://www.wired.com/2008/01/ff-iphone/ .
    继 iPod 取得成功之后，观看了：Fred Vogelstein，“不为人知的故事：iPhone 如何颠覆无线行业”，《连线》杂志，2008 年 1 月 9 日，https://www.wired.com/2008/01/ff-iphone/。
  • became less and less satisfied: Mic Wright, “The Original iPhone Announcement Annotated: Steve Jobs’ Genius Meets Genius,” TNW, September 9, 2015, https://thenextweb.com/apple/2015/09/09/genius-annotated-with-genius/ .
    越来越不满意：Mic Wright，“iPhone 初代发布会注释：史蒂夫·乔布斯的天才与天才的相遇”，TNW，2015 年 9 月 9 日，https://thenextweb.com/apple/2015/09/09/genius-annotated-with-genius/。
  • burdened with a bunch of other devices: Ibid.
    还背负着许多其他设备：同上。
  • people needed one easy-to-use device: Ibid.
    人们需要一款易于使用的设备：同上。
  • the only accessory it needed: Ibid.
    它唯一需要的配件：同上。
  • set Apple’s engineers to work: Vogelstein, “The Untold Story: How the iPhone Blew Up the Wireless Industry.”
    让苹果公司的工程师们开始工作：Vogelstein，“不为人知的故事：iPhone 如何颠覆无线行业”。
  • having negotiated a deal for their subsidiary: Ibid.
    与其子公司达成协议：同上。
  • AT&T would have exclusive distribution rights: Ibid.
    AT&T 将拥有独家分销权：同上。
  • from each customer’s wireless bill every month: Ibid.
    从每位客户的每月无线账单中扣除：同上。
  • Apple also retained control: Ibid.
    苹果公司也保留了控制权：同上。
  • never been seen before: Ibid.
    前所未见：同上。
  • told Forbes magazine: Peter Cohan, “How Steve Jobs got ATT to Share Revenue,” Forbes , August 16, 2013, https://www.forbes.com/sites/petercohan/2013/08/16/how-steve-jobs-got-att-to-share-revenue/#527ef4f0391c .
    告诉《福布斯》杂志：Peter Cohan，“史蒂夫·乔布斯如何让AT&T分享收入”，《福布斯》，2013年8月16日，https://www.forbes.com/sites/petercohan/2013/08/16/how-steve-jobs-got-att-to-share-revenue/#527ef4f0391c。
  • quickly captured a sizable segment: “5 Years Later: A Look Back at the Rise of the iPhone,” Comscore, June 29, 2012, https://www.comscore.com/Insights/Blog/5-Years-Later-A-Look-Back-at-the-Rise-of-the-iPhone .
    迅速占据了相当大的市场份额：“5 年之后：回顾 iPhone 的崛起”，Comscore，2012 年 6 月 29 日，https://www.comscore.com/Insights/Blog/5-Years-Later-A-Look-Back-at-the-Rise-of-the-iPhone。
  • “For Jobs and the iPhone”: Kevin Ashton, “How to Fly a Horse: The Secret of Steve,” October 2, 2019, http://howtoflyahorse.com/the-secret-of-steve/ .
    “为了乔布斯和 iPhone”：凯文·阿什顿，“如何让马飞起来：史蒂夫的秘密”，2019 年 10 月 2 日，http://howtoflyahorse.com/the-secret-of-steve/。
  • 10 percent or more of school days: “The Problem,” Attendance Works, Oct. 2, 2019, https://www.attendanceworks.org/chronic-absence/the-problem/ .
    10% 或以上的上学日：“问题”，Attendance Works，2019 年 10 月 2 日，https://www.attendanceworks.org/chronic-absence/the-problem/。
  • can translate into: Ibid.
    可以翻译为：同上。
  • According to non-profit Attendance Works: Ibid.
    根据非营利组织 Attendance Works 的说法：同上。
  • after combining the clothes-washing program: Emily S. Rueb, “Schools Find a New Way to Combat Student Absences: Washing Machines,” New York Times , Mar. 13, 2019, https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/13/us/schools-laundry-rooms.html .
    在结合了洗衣计划之后：Emily S. Rueb，“学校找到了对抗学生缺勤的新方法：洗衣机”，《纽约时报》，2019 年 3 月 13 日，https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/13/us/schools-laundry-rooms.html。
  • “Creating is not a result of genius”: Ashton, “How to Fly a Horse: The Secret of Steve.”
    “创造并非天才的产物”：阿什顿，《如何让马飞翔：史蒂夫的秘密》。
  • “Twenty-five percent of failures were due to”: John Kennedy, “Darrell Mann: 98pc of Innovation Projects Fail, How to Be the 2pc that Don’t,” Silicon Republic , February 23, 2013, https://www.siliconrepublic.com/innovation/darrell-mann-98pc-of-innovation-projects-fail-how-to-be-the-2pc-that-dont .
    “25% 的失败是由于”：John Kennedy，“Darrell Mann：98% 的创新项目失败，如何成为那 2% 的成功者”，Silicon Republic，2013 年 2 月 23 日，https://www.siliconrepublic.com/innovation/darrell-mann-98pc-of-innovation-projects-fail-how-to-be-the-2pc-that-dont。
  • humans tend to avoid: Erik van Mechelen, “Substituting a Hard Question for an Easier One: Daniel Kahneman’s Thinking, Fast and Slow ,” Yukaichou (blog), October 2, 2019, https://yukaichou.com/behavioral-analysis/substituting-hard-question-easier-one-daniel-kahnemans-thinking-fast-thinking-slow/ .
    人类倾向于回避：Erik van Mechelen，“用更简单的问题代替难题：丹尼尔·卡尼曼的《思考，快与慢》”，Yukaichou（博客），2019 年 10 月 2 日，https://yukaichou.com/behavioral-analysis/substituting-hard-question-easier-one-daniel-kahnemans-thinking-fast-thinking-slow/。
  • the situation as it stands today: Michael Cooper, “Defining Problems: The Most Important Business Skill You’ve Never Been Taught,” Entrepreneur , September 26, 2014, https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/237668 .
    目前的状况：Michael Cooper，“定义问题：你从未被教过的最重要的商业技能”，Entrepreneur，2014 年 9 月 26 日，https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/237668。
  • give you the clearest, most concise picture: Ibid.
    给你最清晰、最简洁的画面：同上。
  • achieve better results when you’re focused on the goal: Andrea Kupfer Schneider, “Aspirations in Negotiations,” Marquette Law Review 87, no. 4 (2004): 675.
    专注于目标就能取得更好的结果：Andrea Kupfer Schneider，“谈判中的抱负”，《马凯特法律评论》87，第 4 期（2004 年）：675。

Two: What Do I Need?

二：我需要什么？

  • You’ll know something is a need: Sheiresa Ngo, “The Real Difference Between Needs and Wants Most People Ignore,” Cheatsheet, November 6, 2017, https://www.cheatsheet.com/money-career/real-difference-between-needs-and-wants-people-ignore.html/ .
    你会知道某件事是必需品：Sheiresa Ngo，“大多数人忽略的需求与欲望之间的真正区别”，Cheatsheet，2017 年 11 月 6 日，https://www.cheatsheet.com/money-career/real-difference-between-needs-and-wants-people-ignore.html/。
  • get more from their negotiations: Sidney Siegel & Lawrence E. Fouraker, Bargaining and Group Decision Making (New York: McGraw-Hill, 1960), 64.
    从谈判中获得更多：Sidney Siegel & Lawrence E. Fouraker，《讨价还价和群体决策》（纽约：麦格劳-希尔出版社，1960 年），第 64 页。
  • “optimistic, specific, and justifiable”: G. Richard Shell, Bargaining for Advantage: Negotiation Strategies for Reasonable People (New York: Viking, 1999), 30–34.
    “乐观、具体、合理”：G. Richard Shell，《谈判优势：理性人的谈判策略》（纽约：Viking，1999 年），第 30-34 页。
  • By identifying our needs: Andrea Kupfer Schneider, “Aspirations in Negotiations,” Marquette Law Review 87, no. 4 (2004): 676.
    通过明确我们的需求：Andrea Kupfer Schneider，“谈判中的愿望”，《马凯特法律评论》87，第 4 期（2004 年）：676。
  • helps us aspire to more: Ibid, 34.
    帮助我们追求更高的目标：同上，第 34 页。
  • Drawn from psychology research: Abraham H. Maslow, “A Theory of Human Motivation,” Psychological Review 50, no. 4 (1943): 394–395.
    摘自心理学研究：亚伯拉罕·H·马斯洛，“人类动机理论”，《心理学评论》50，第 4 期（1943 年）：394-395。
  • “The link between hunger and conflict”: Edith M. Lederer, “UN: Conflict Key Cause of 124 Million Hungry Who Could Die,” AP News, March 23, 2018, https://www.apnews.com/c37f7a8da9cc4eaebf3fe7c48711aa37 .
    “饥饿与冲突之间的联系”：伊迪丝·M·莱德勒，“联合国：冲突是导致 1.24 亿饥饿人口死亡的主要原因”，美联社新闻，2018 年 3 月 23 日，https://www.apnews.com/c37f7a8da9cc4eaebf3fe7c48711aa37。
  • “Conflict leads to food insecurity”: Ibid.
    “冲突导致粮食不安全”：同上。
  • “food insecurity can also stoke instability”: Ibid.
    “粮食不安全也可能加剧不稳定”：同上。
  • 60 percent of the 815 million: Ibid.
    8.15亿中的60%：同上。
  • major determinant of both happiness and productivity: Annie McKee, How to Be Happy at Work: The Power of Purpose, Hope, and Friendship (Boston: Harvard Business Review Press, 2018), 13.
    幸福和生产力的主要决定因素：安妮·麦基，《如何在工作中获得幸福：目标、希望和友谊的力量》（波士顿：哈佛商业评论出版社，2018 年），第 13 页。
  • respect, which means admiration for someone: “Respect,” Merriam-Webster , October 16, 2019, https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/respect .
    尊重，意味着对某人的钦佩：“尊重”，韦氏词典，2019 年 10 月 16 日，https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/respect。
  • lack of respect in a partnership: John Mordechai Gottman & Nan Silver, The Seven Principles for Making Marriage Work (New York: Random House, 1999), 29–31, 65–66.
    伴侣关系中缺乏尊重：约翰·莫迪凯·戈特曼和南·西尔弗，《让婚姻成功的七项原则》（纽约：兰登书屋，1999 年），第 29-31 页，第 65-66 页。
  • one of the “Four Horsemen” that predicts divorce: Ibid., 27.
    预言离婚的“四骑士”之一：同上，第 27 页。
  • more likely to give it in return: Robert Cialdini, “The Six Principles of Successful Workplace Negotiation,” Controlled Environments, September 4, 2015.
    更有可能给予回报：罗伯特·西奥迪尼，《成功职场谈判的六项原则》，受控环境，2015 年 9 月 4 日。
  • Respect creates trust: Ibid; Jeswald Salacuse, “The Importance of a Relationship in Negotiation,” Program on Negotiation, Harvard Law School, June 18, 2019, https://www.pon.harvard.edu/daily/negotiation-training-daily/negotiate-relationships/ .
    尊重创造信任：同上；Jeswald Salacuse，“关系在谈判中的重要性”，哈佛大学法学院谈判项目，2019 年 6 月 18 日，https://www.pon.harvard.edu/daily/negotiation-training-daily/negotiate-relationships/。
  • Dignity, which in some cultures is called “face”: Bert R. Brown, “Saving Face,” Psychology Today 4, no. 12 (May 1971), 56–57.
    尊严，在某些文化中被称为“面子”：Bert R. Brown，“保全面子”，《今日心理学》4，第 12 期（1971 年 5 月），56-57 页。
  • sense of pride and worthiness: “Dignity,” Merriam-Webster , October 16, 2019, https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/dignity .
    自豪感和价值感：“尊严”，韦氏词典，2019 年 10 月 16 日，https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/dignity。
  • critical to their well-being: Jonathan M. Mann, “Dignity, Well-Being and Quality of Life,” in Longevity and Quality of Life: Opportunities and Challenges , ed. Robert N Butler & Claude Jasmin (New York: Kluwer Academic, 2000), 149.
    对他们的福祉至关重要：Jonathan M. Mann，“尊严、福祉和生活质量”，载于《长寿与生活质量：机遇与挑战》，Robert N Butler 和 Claude Jasmin 编辑（纽约：Kluwer Academic，2000 年），第 149 页。
  • need to know that they are in charge: Roger Fisher & Daniel Shapiro, Beyond Reason: Using Emotions as You Negotiate (New York: Viking Penguin, 2005), 211.
    需要知道他们掌握着主动权：罗杰·费舍尔和丹尼尔·夏皮罗，《超越理性：在谈判中使用情绪》（纽约：维京企鹅出版社，2005 年），第 211 页。
  • can help satisfy these self-direction needs: Ibid; Sue Grossman, “Offering Children Choices: Encouraging Autonomy and Learning While Minimizing Conflicts,” Early Childhood News , October 16, 2019, www.earlychildhoodnews.com/earlychildhood/article_view.aspx?ArticleID=607 .
    可以帮助满足这些自主需求：同上；Sue Grossman，“为孩子提供选择：鼓励自主学习，同时最大限度地减少冲突”，《幼儿新闻》，2019 年 10 月 16 日，www.earlychildhoodnews.com/earlychildhood/article_view.aspx?ArticleID=607。
  • “Life is a process of becoming”: Evelyn J. Hinz, The Mirror and the Garden: Realism and Reality in the Writings of Anaïs Nin (1973), 40.
    “生命是一个生成的过程”：伊芙琳·J·欣茨，《镜子与花园：阿娜伊斯·宁作品中的现实主义与现实》（1973 年），第 40 页。

Three: What Do I Feel?

三：我的感受是什么？

  • our feelings help us make decisions: Jim Camp, “Decisions are Largely Emotional, Not Logical: The Neuroscience Behind Decision-Making,” Big Think, June 11, 2012, https://bigthink.com/experts-corner/decisions-are-emotional-not-logical-the-neuroscience-behind-decision-making .
    我们的感觉帮助我们做出决定：Jim Camp，“决策很大程度上是情绪化的，而不是逻辑性的：决策背后的神经科学”，Big Think，2012 年 6 月 11 日，https://bigthink.com/experts-corner/decisions-are-emotional-not-logical-the-neuroscience-behind-decision-making。
  • found that they were unable to make decisions: Antonio Damasio, Descartes’ Error: Emotion, Reason, and the Human Brain (New York: G.P. Putnam, 1994), 38-39, 50, 63.
    发现他们无法做出决定：Antonio Damasio，《笛卡尔的错误：情感、理性与人脑》（纽约：G.P. Putnam，1994 年），第 38-39、50、63 页。
  • couldn’t even decide what to eat: Jonah Lehrer, “Feeling Our Way to Decision,” Sydney Morning Herald , February 28, 2009, https://www.smh.com.au/national/feeling-our-way-to-decision-20090227-8k8v.html .
    甚至连吃什么都决定不了：Jonah Lehrer，“凭感觉做决定”，《悉尼先驱晨报》，2009 年 2 月 28 日，https://www.smh.com.au/national/feeling-our-way-to-decision-20090227-8k8v.html。
  • can enhance our ability to judge: Barbara L. Friedrickson, “What Good are Positive Emotions?,” Review of General Psychology 2, no. 3 (1998): 300.
    可以增强我们的判断能力：Barbara L. Friedrickson，“积极情绪有什么好处？”，《普通心理学评论》2，第 3 期（1998 年）：300。
  • can inhibit these abilities: Christopher Bergland, “How Does Anxiety Short Circuit the Decision-Making Process?,” Psychology Today , March 17, 2016, https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/the-athletes-way/201603/how-does-anxiety-short-circuit-the-decision-making-process .
    焦虑会抑制这些能力：Christopher Bergland，“焦虑如何阻碍决策过程？”，《今日心理学》，2016 年 3 月 17 日，https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/the-athletes-way/201603/how-does-anxiety-short-circuit-the-decision-making-process。
  • in a way that impedes our ability: Jessica J. Flynn, Tom Hollenstein & Allison Mackey, “The Effect of Suppressing and Not Accepting Emotions on Depressive Symptoms: Is Suppression Different for Men and Women?,” Personality and Individual Differences 49, no. 6 (2010): 582.
    以某种方式阻碍我们的能力：Jessica J. Flynn、Tom Hollenstein 和 Allison Mackey，“抑制和不接受情绪对抑郁症状的影响：男性和女性的抑制方式是否不同？”，《人格与个体差异》49，第 6 期（2010 年）：582。
  • worked on devising groups of core emotions: Brené Brown, “List of Core Emotions,” March 2018, https://brenebrown.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/List-of-Core-Emotions-2018.pdf .
    致力于制定核心情绪组：Brené Brown，“核心情绪列表”，2018 年 3 月，https://brenebrown.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/List-of-Core-Emotions-2018.pdf。
  • “Let us never negotiate out of fear”: John F. Kennedy, “Inaugural Address,” CNN, January 20, 1961, http://www.cnn.com/2011/POLITICS/01/20/kennedy.inaugural/index.html .
    “我们绝不因恐惧而谈判”：约翰·F·肯尼迪，“就职演说”，CNN，1961 年 1 月 20 日，http://www.cnn.com/2011/POLITICS/01/20/kennedy.inaugural/index.html。
  • have been shown to help build a connection: Barbara Fredrickson, “Are you Getting Enough Positivity in Your Diet?,” Greater Good Magazine , June 21, 2011, https://greatergood.berkeley.edu/article/item/are_you_getting_enough_positivity_in_your_diet
    研究表明，积极心态有助于建立联系：芭芭拉·弗雷德里克森，《你的饮食中是否摄入了足够的积极能量？》，《美好生活》杂志，2011年6月21日，https://greatergood.berkeley.edu/article/item/are_you_getting_enough_positivity_in_your_diet
  • you may experience more difficulty: Meina Liu, “The Intrapersonal and Interpersonal Effects of Anger on Negotiation Strategies: A Cross-Cultural Investigation,” Human Communication Research 35, no. 1 (2009): 148–69; Bo Shao, Lu Wang, David Cheng & Lorna Doucet, “Anger Suppression in Negotiations: The Roles of Attentional Focus and Anger Source,” Journal of Business & Psychology 30, no. 4 (December 2015): 755.
    您可能会遇到更多困难：Meina Liu，“愤怒对谈判策略的个体内部和人际影响：一项跨文化调查”，《人类沟通研究》35，第 1 期（2009 年）：148-69；Bo Shao、Lu Wang、David Cheng 和 Lorna Doucet，“谈判中的愤怒抑制：注意力焦点和愤怒来源的作用”，《商业与心理学杂志》30，第 4 期（2015 年 12 月）：755。
  • has been shown to lead to mixed results: Program on Negotiation Staff, “Negotiation Strategies: Emotional Expression at the Bargaining Table,” Harvard Law School Program on Negotiation: Daily Blog , June 6, 2019, https://www.pon.harvard.edu/daily/negotiation-skills-daily/emotional-expression-in-negotiation/ .
    已证明会导致好坏参半的结果：谈判项目工作人员，“谈判策略：谈判桌上的情绪表达”，哈佛大学法学院谈判项目：每日博客，2019 年 6 月 6 日，https://www.pon.harvard.edu/daily/negotiation-skills-daily/emotional-expression-in-negotiation/。
  • may be more likely to make concessions: Jeff Falk-Rice, “In Negotiations, A Little Anger May Help,” Futurity, March 15, 2018, https://www.futurity.org/anger-in-negotiations-emotions-1704482/ .
    可能更倾向于做出让步：Jeff Falk-Rice，“在谈判中，一点愤怒可能会有所帮助”，Futurity，2018 年 3 月 15 日，https://www.futurity.org/anger-in-negotiations-emotions-1704482/。
  • less likely to want to do business: Keith G. Allred, John S. Mallozzi, Fusako Matsui & Christopher P. Raia, “The Influence of Anger and Compassion on Negotiation Performance,” Organizational Behavior and Human Decision Processes 70, no. 3 (June 1997): 177.
    不太可能想做生意：Keith G. Allred、John S. Mallozzi、Fusako Matsui 和 Christopher P. Raia，“愤怒和同情对谈判表现的影响”，《组织行为与人类决策过程》70，第 3 期（1997 年 6 月）：177。
  • less power than your counterpart: Mithu Storoni, “It Pays to Get Angry In a Negotiation—If You Do It Right,” Inc ., May 11, 2017, https://www.inc.com/mithu-storoni/it-pays-to-get-angry-in-a-negotiation-if-you-do-it-right.html .
    与你的对手相比，权力较小：Mithu Storoni，“在谈判中生气是有好处的——如果你做得对”，Inc.，2017 年 5 月 11 日，https://www.inc.com/mithu-storoni/it-pays-to-get-angry-in-a-negotiation-if-you-do-it-right.html。
  • Anxiety in negotiation can lead: Alison Wood Brooks & Maurice E. Schweitzer, “Can Nervous Nelly Negotiate? How Anxiety Causes Negotiators to Make Low First Offers, Exit Early, and Earn Less Profit,” Organizational Behavior and Human Decision Processes 115, no. 1 (May 2011): 51.
    谈判中的焦虑会导致：Alison Wood Brooks 和 Maurice E. Schweitzer，“紧张的内莉能谈判吗？焦虑如何导致谈判者给出较低的初始报价、提前退出并赚取较少的利润”，《组织行为与人类决策过程》115，第 1 期（2011 年 5 月）：51。

Four: How Have I Handled This Successfully in the Past?

第四：我过去是如何成功处理这件事的？

  • more likely to achieve better results: Joris Lammers, David Dubois, Derek D. Rucker & Adam D. Galinsky, “Power Gets the Job: Priming Power Improves Interview Outcomes,” Journal of Experimental Social Psychology 49, no. 4 (July 2013): 778.
    更有可能取得更好的结果：Joris Lammers、David Dubois、Derek D. Rucker 和 Adam D. Galinsky，“权力带来工作：启动权力改善面试结果”，《实验社会心理学杂志》49，第 4 期（2013 年 7 月）：778。
  • One study at Columbia found: Ibid.
    哥伦比亚大学的一项研究发现：同上。
  • researchers at Harvard Business School found: Kimberlyn Leary, Julianna Pillemer & Michael Wheeler, “Negotiating with Emotion,” Harvard Business Review , January–February 2013, 96, 99, https://hbr.org/2013/01/negotiating-with-emotion .
    哈佛商学院的研究人员发现：Kimberlyn Leary、Julianna Pillemer 和 Michael Wheeler，“用情绪进行谈判”，《哈佛商业评论》，2013 年 1 月至 2 月，第 96、99 页，https://hbr.org/2013/01/negotiating-with-emotion。
  • this effect is self-reinforcing: Theresa Amabile & Steven Kramer, The Progress Principle: Using Small Wins to Ignite Joy, Engagement, and Creativity at Work (Boston: Harvard Business Review Press, 2011), 69.
    这种效应是自我强化的：Theresa Amabile 和 Steven Kramer，《进步原则：利用小胜利激发工作中的快乐、参与和创造力》（波士顿：哈佛商业评论出版社，2011 年），第 69 页。
  • Says the Harvard Business Review : Leary et al., “Negotiating with Emotion.”
    《哈佛商业评论》指出：Leary 等人，《用情感进行谈判》。

Five: What’s the First Step?

第五步：第一步是什么？

  • “close the gap between home and fashion”: Mei Xu, “Chesapeake Bay Candle: Mei Xu,” interview by Guy Raz, How I Built This , NPR, March 6, 2017, Audio, 10:16, https://www.npr.org/2017/03/06/518132220/chesapeake-bay-candle-mei-xu .
    “弥合家居与时尚之间的差距”：梅旭，“切萨皮克湾蜡烛：梅旭”，盖伊·拉兹采访，《我是如何打造这一切的》，NPR，2017 年 3 月 6 日，音频，10:16，https://www.npr.org/2017/03/06/518132220/chesapeake-bay-candle-mei-xu。
  • which she launched in 1994: “Chesapeake Bay Candle,” Newell Brands, October 10, 2019, https://www.newellbrands.com/our-brands/chesapeake-bay-candle .
    她在 1994 年推出了“切萨皮克湾蜡烛”品牌，Newell Brands，2019 年 10 月 10 日，https://www.newellbrands.com/our-brands/chesapeake-bay-candle。
  • now-famous negotiation success story: Brad McRae, Negotiating and Influencing Skills: The Art of Creating and Claiming Value (California: SAGE Publications, 1998), 19.
    如今著名的谈判成功案例：布拉德·麦克雷，《谈判与影响力技巧：创造和获取价值的艺术》（加利福尼亚州：SAGE 出版社，1998 年），第 19 页。
  • planned for a whistle-stop trip: Ibid.
    计划进行一次短暂的旅行：同上。
  • printed three million copies: Ibid.
    印刷了三百万册：同上。
  • they had not secured permission: Ibid.
    他们没有获得许可：同上。
  • they could be liable: Ibid.
    他们可能要承担责任：同上。
  • couldn’t afford the risk: Ibid.
    承担不起风险：同上。
  • came up with one: Ibid.
    我想出了一个：同上。
  • sent Moffett Studios the following cable: Ibid.
    向莫菲特工作室发送了以下电报：同上。
  • “We are planning to distribute”: Ibid.
    “我们计划分发”：同上。
  • Moffett replied to the cable: Ibid.
    莫菲特回复电报：同上。
  • They accepted: Ibid.
    他们接受了：同上。
  • turned a potential liability: Ibid.
    变成了潜在的负担：同上。
  • consider the worst-case scenario: Ayse Birsel, “Your Worst Idea Might Be Your Best Idea,” Inc. , February 16, 2017, https://www.inc.com/ayse-birsel/your-worst-idea-might-be-your-best-idea.html .
    考虑最坏的情况：Ayse Birsel，“你最糟糕的想法可能是你最好的想法”，Inc.，2017 年 2 月 16 日，https://www.inc.com/ayse-birsel/your-worst-idea-might-be-your-best-idea.html。
  • just as well (or better) for negotiations that involve a group: Ibid.
    对于涉及群体的谈判来说，情况也同样如此（甚至更好）：同上。
  • some companies use this technique: John Geraci, “Embracing Bad Ideas to Get to Good Ideas,” Harvard Business Review , December 27, 2016, https://hbr.org/2016/12/embracing-bad-ideas-to-get-to-good-ideas .
    一些公司使用这种技术：John Geraci，“拥抱坏想法以获得好想法”，《哈佛商业评论》，2016 年 12 月 27 日，https://hbr.org/2016/12/embracing-bad-ideas-to-get-to-good-ideas。
  • 3M calls this “reverse thinking”: “Reverse Thinking: Turning the Problem Upside Down,” Post-it, 3M, October 6, 2019, https://www.post-it.com/3M/en__US/post-it/ideas/articles/reverse-thinking/ .
    3M 将此称为“逆向思维”：“逆向思维：将问题翻转过来”，Post-it，3M，2019 年 10 月 6 日，https://www.post-it.com/3M/en__US/post-it/ideas/articles/reverse-thinking/。
#↩

Part 2: The Window

第二部分：窗户

  • “When people talk, listen completely”: Ernest Hemingway, “Quotes,” Goodreads, October 6, 2019, https://www.goodreads.com/quotes/1094622-when-people-talk-listen-completely-don-t-be-thinking-what-you-re .
    “当人们说话时，要全神贯注地倾听”：欧内斯特·海明威，“语录”，Goodreads，2019 年 10 月 6 日，https://www.goodreads.com/quotes/1094622-when-people-talk-listen-completely-don-t-be-thinking-what-you-re。
  • “Most people never listen”: Ibid.
    “大多数人从不听”：同上。
  • often fail to hear—or worse, actively devalue: Will Tumonis, “How Reactive Devaluation Distorts Our Judgment,” Ideation Wi z, December 17, 2014, https://www.ideationwiz.com/reactive-devaluation/ .
    经常听不到——或者更糟的是，会主动贬低：Will Tumonis，“反应性贬值如何扭曲我们的判断”，Ideation Wiz，2014 年 12 月 17 日，https://www.ideationwiz.com/reactive-devaluation/。
  • we are less than perfect listeners: Ralph G. Nichols & Leonard A. Stevens, “Listening to People,” Harvard Business Review , September 1957, https://hbr.org/1957/09/listening-to-people .
    我们并非完美的倾听者：Ralph G. Nichols 和 Leonard A. Stevens，“倾听他人”，《哈佛商业评论》，1957 年 9 月，https://hbr.org/1957/09/listening-to-people。
  • 93 percent of all negotiators failed to ask: Leigh Thompson, The Mind and Heart of the Negotiator (Upper Saddle River, NJ: Pearson/Prentice Hall, 2005), 77.
    93% 的谈判者没有提出这个问题：Leigh Thompson，《谈判者的思想和心灵》（新泽西州上萨德尔河：Pearson/Prentice Hall，2005 年），第 77 页。
  • cluelessness, or a lack of strategic thinking, can result: Michael Suk-Young Chwe, Jane Austen, Game Theorist: Updated Edition (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 2013), 188.
    缺乏战略思维或无知可能导致这种情况：Michael Suk-Young Chwe，《简·奥斯汀，博弈论家：更新版》（新泽西州普林斯顿：普林斯顿大学出版社，2013 年），第 188 页。
  • empathic listeners not only create better connections: Sharon Myers, “Empathic Listening: Reports on the Experience of Being Heard,” Journal of Humanistic Psychology 40, no. 2 (2000): 171.
    善解人意的倾听者不仅能建立更好的联系：Sharon Myers，“善解人意的倾听：关于被倾听的体验的报告”，《人本主义心理学杂志》40，第 2 期（2000 年）：171。
  • when you listen in order to understand: Stephen R. Covey, The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change (New York: Simon & Schuster, 1989), 239–40.
    当你为了理解而倾听时：史蒂芬·R·柯维，《高效能人士的7个习惯：个人改变的强大课程》（纽约：西蒙与舒斯特出版社，1989年），239-40页。
  • More than 50 percent of communication is non-verbal: Allan & Barbara Pease, “The Definitive Book of Body Language,” New York Times, September 24, 2006, https://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/24/books/chapters/0924-1st-peas.html ; Albert Mehrabian: Silent Messages: Implicit Communication of Emotions and Attitudes (Belmont, CA: Wadsworth Publishing Co., 1981).
    超过 50% 的沟通是非语言的：Allan & Barbara Pease，“肢体语言权威指南”，《纽约时报》，2006 年 9 月 24 日，https://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/24/books/chapters/0924-1st-peas.html；Albert Mehrabian：《无声的信息：情绪和态度的隐性沟通》（加利福尼亚州贝尔蒙特：沃兹沃思出版社，1981 年）。
  • “Even when you know a person well”: Chwe, Jane Austen, Game Theorist: Updated Edition , 17.
    “即使你很了解一个人”：Chwe，简·奥斯汀，《博弈论者：更新版》，17。
  • “A person with good nunchi can understand”: Ibid.
    “有眼力的人就能理解”：同上。
  • observe someone’s default, or baseline: Carol Kinsey Goman, “How to Read Business Body Language Like a Pro-5th Tip,” Forbes , December 28, 2012, https://www.forbes.com/sites/carolkinseygoman/2012/12/28/how-to-read-business-body-language-like-a-pro-5th-tip/#54e7b7a463b5 .
    观察某人的默认状态或基准：Carol Kinsey Goman，“如何像专业人士一样解读商务肢体语言 - 第 5 个技巧”，福布斯，2012 年 12 月 28 日，https://www.forbes.com/sites/carolkinseygoman/2012/12/28/how-to-read-business-body-language-like-a-pro-5th-tip/#54e7b7a463b5。

Six: Tell Me…

六：告诉我……

  • a lifelong member of the Church of Latter-Day Saints: Libby Coleman, “There’s a Reason He’s the Highest-Ranking Dem in Utah,” Ozy, February 20, 2017, https://www.ozy.com/politics-and-power/theres-a-reason-hes-the-highest-ranking-dem-in-utah/75784 .
    终身摩门教成员：Libby Coleman，“他是犹他州排名最高的民主党人是有原因的”，Ozy，2017 年 2 月 20 日，https://www.ozy.com/politics-and-power/theres-a-reason-hes-the-highest-ranking-dem-in-utah/75784。
  • is a first-time United States congressperson: Lee Davidson, “It’s Over. Democrat Ben McAdams Ousts Republican Rep. Mia Love by 694 Votes,” Salt Lake Tribune , November 21, 2018, https://www.sltrib.com/news/politics/2018/11/20/its-over-democrat-ben/ .
    首次当选美国国会议员：Lee Davidson，“结束了。民主党人本·麦克亚当斯以 694 票的优势击败共和党众议员米娅·洛夫”，《盐湖城论坛报》，2018 年 11 月 21 日，https://www.sltrib.com/news/politics/2018/11/20/its-over-democrat-ben/。
  • unusual for a practicing Mormon: Coleman, “There’s a Reason He’s the Highest-Ranking Dem in Utah.”
    对于一个虔诚的摩门教徒来说，这很不寻常：科尔曼说：“他能成为犹他州级别最高的民主党人是有原因的。”
  • has spent much of his adult life: Ibid.
    他成年后的大部分时间都花在了这里：同上。
  • One day in 2008: Jared Page, “Ben McAdams Quiets Critics with Willingness to Listen, Compromise,” Deseret News , August 12, 2012, https://www.deseretnews.com/article/865560557/Ben-McAdams-quiets-critics-with-willingness-to-listen-compromise.html .
    2008 年的某一天：Jared Page，“Ben McAdams 以愿意倾听和妥协来平息批评”，《德塞雷特新闻报》，2012 年 8 月 12 日，https://www.deseretnews.com/article/865560557/Ben-McAdams-quiets-critics-with-willingness-to-listen-compromise.html。
  • 2008, the year in which the Mormon Church: Jesse McKinley & Kirk Johnson, “Mormons Tipped Scale in Ban on Gay Marriage,” New York Times , November 14, 2008, https://www.nytimes.com/2008/11/15/us/politics/15marriage.html .
    2008 年，摩门教会：杰西·麦金利和柯克·约翰逊，“摩门教徒在禁止同性婚姻中占了上风”，《纽约时报》，2008 年 11 月 14 日，https://www.nytimes.com/2008/11/15/us/politics/15marriage.html。
  • proposed a “Domestic-Partnership Registry: Page, “Ben McAdams Quiets Critics with Willingness to Listen, Compromise.”
    提议建立“家庭伴侣登记处”：Page，“本·麦克亚当斯以愿意倾听和妥协来平息批评”。
  • including from within McAdams’s own religion: Page; “Buttars Shames LDS Church,” Deseret News , January 30, 2006, https://www.deseret.com/2006/1/30/19935132/buttars-shames-lds-church .
    包括来自麦克亚当斯自己的宗教内部：Page；“Buttars Shames LDS Church”，《Deseret News》，2006 年 1 月 30 日，https://www.deseret.com/2006/1/30/19935132/buttars-shames-lds-church。
  • resisted the ordinance: Ibid.
    抵制该法令：同上。
  • to set up a meeting: Ibid.
    安排会议：同上。
  • “I usually find that when I listen”: Ibid.
    “我通常在倾听时会发现这一点”：同上。
  • led to the creation of Salt Lake City’s Mutual Commitment Registry: Ibid.
    促成了盐湖城互助承诺登记处的建立：同上。
  • modified ordinance was unanimously approved: Ibid.
    修改后的法令获得一致通过：同上。
  • Julie (herself a trained mediator), later told: Ibid.
    Julie（她本人是一位训练有素的调解员）后来表示：同上。
  • “wellsprings of innovation”: Alison Wood Brooks & Leslie K. John, “The Surprising Power of Questions,” Harvard Business Review , May–June 2018, 60, 64, https://hbr.org/2018/05/the-surprising-power-of-questions .
    “创新的源泉”：Alison Wood Brooks 和 Leslie K. John，“问题的惊人力量”，《哈佛商业评论》，2018 年 5 月至 6 月，第 60、64 页，https://hbr.org/2018/05/the-surprising-power-of-questions。
  • have called a “learning conversation”: Douglas Stone, Bruce Patton & Sheila Heen, Difficult Conversations (New York: Penguin Books, 2010), 16–20.
    称之为“学习对话”：道格拉斯·斯通、布鲁斯·帕顿和希拉·希恩，《困难的对话》（纽约：企鹅出版社，2010 年），第 16-20 页。
  • an elected member and Deputy Speaker: “Assemblywoman Mila Jasey Named Deputy Speaker of General Assembly,” The Village Green , September 22, 2016, https://villagegreennj.com/towns/assemblywoman-mila-jasey-named-deputy-speaker-general-assembly/ .
    一位当选议员兼副议长：“州议员米拉·杰西被任命为州议会副议长”，《乡村绿地》，2016 年 9 月 22 日，https://villagegreennj.com/towns/assemblywoman-mila-jasey-named-deputy-speaker-general-assembly/。
  • won an important legislative battle on a divisive issue: “NJSBA Applauds End of Unnecessary Superintendent Salary CAP,” New Jersey School Boards Association, July 20, 2019, https://www.njsba.org/news-publications/press-releases/njsba-applauds-end-of-unnecessary-superintendent-salary-cap/ .
    在一次重要的立法斗争中，新泽西州学校董事会协会就一个有争议的问题赢得了胜利：“新泽西州学校董事会协会赞扬结束不必要的校长薪资上限”，2019 年 7 月 20 日，https://www.njsba.org/news-publications/press-releases/njsba-applauds-end-of-unnecessary-superintendent-salary-cap/。
  • had instituted a salary cap for superintendents: Joe Hernandez, “N.J. Considers Eliminating Cap on Superintendent Pay,” Whyy, June 10, 2019, https://whyy.org/articles/n-j-considers-eliminating-cap-on-superintendent-pay/ .
    曾对学区总监实行工资上限：Joe Hernandez，“新泽西州考虑取消学区总监工资上限”，Whyy，2019 年 6 月 10 日，https://whyy.org/articles/n-j-considers-eliminating-cap-on-superintendent-pay/。
  • “Tell me about yourself” is the only ice-breaker you need: Jolie Kerr, “How to Talk to People, According to Terry Gross,” New York Times , November 17, 2018, https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/17/style/self-care/terry-gross-conversation-advice.html .
    “告诉我一些关于你自己的事情”是你唯一需要的破冰方式：Jolie Kerr，“根据Terry Gross的建议如何与人交谈”，《纽约时报》，2018年11月17日，https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/17/style/self-care/terry-gross-conversation-advice.html。
  • “The beauty in opening with ‘tell me about yourself’ ”: Ibid.
    “以‘请介绍一下你自己’开头的美妙之处”：同上。

Seven: What Do You Need?

第七：你需要什么？

  • needs, not rights, are the real reason: Charles Vincent, Magi Young & Angela Phillips, “Why Do People Sue Doctors? A Study of Patients And Relatives Taking Legal Action,” The Lancet 343, no. 8913 (June 1994): 1611–13.
    真正的原因是需求，而不是权利：Charles Vincent、Magi Young 和 Angela Phillips，“人们为什么起诉医生？一项关于患者及其亲属采取法律行动的研究”，《柳叶刀》343，第 8913 期（1994 年 6 月）：1611-13。
  • yields deep-seated, important information: Katie Shonk, “Principled Negotiation: Focus on Interests to Create Value,” Program on Negotiation, Harvard Law School , May 9, 2019, https://www.pon.harvard.edu/daily/negotiation-skills-daily/principled-negotiation-focus-interests-create-value/ ; Douglas Stone, Bruce Patton & Sheila Heen, Difficult Conversations (Penguin Books, 2010), 210–216.
    提供了深刻而重要的信息：Katie Shonk，“有原则的谈判：关注利益以创造价值”，哈佛大学法学院谈判项目，2019 年 5 月 9 日，https://www.pon.harvard.edu/daily/negotiation-skills-daily/principled-negotiation-focus-interests-create-value/；Douglas Stone、Bruce Patton 和 Sheila Heen，《艰难的对话》（企鹅出版社，2010 年），第 210-216 页。
  • Social workers rarely ask why questions: “Interviewing Skill Development and Practice,” Georgia Division of Family and Children Services , March 2007, 10, dfcs.dhr.georgia.gov/sites/dfcs.georgia.gov/files/imported/DHR-DFCS/DHR_DFCS-Edu/Files/PG_intermediate%20interviewing_rev03-07.pdf .
    社会工作者很少问为什么问题：“访谈技能发展与实践”，佐治亚州家庭和儿童服务部，2007 年 3 月，第 10 页，dfcs.dhr.georgia.gov/sites/dfcs.georgia.gov/files/imported/DHR-DFCS/DHR_DFCS-Edu/Files/PG_intermediate%20interviewing_rev03-07.pdf。

Eight: What Are Your Concerns?

八：您有哪些顾虑？

  • information that will be critical: Caroline Cenzia-Levine, “Stuck in a Negotiation? Five Steps to Take when You Hear No to Your Request,” Forbes , August 12, 2018, https://www.forbes.com/sites/carolinecenizalevine/2018/08/12/stuck-in-a-negotiation-five-steps-to-take-when-you-hear-no-to-your-request/#69a7aea2737c .
    关键信息：Caroline Cenzia-Levine，“谈判陷入僵局？当你的请求被拒绝时，可以采取的五个步骤”，《福布斯》，2018 年 8 月 12 日，https://www.forbes.com/sites/carolinecenizalevine/2018/08/12/stuck-in-a-negotiation-five-steps-to-take-when-you-hear-no-to-your-request/#69a7aea2737c。
  • is that it builds rapport: PON Staff, “Negotiating Skills: Learn How to Build Trust at the Negotiation Table,” Program on Negotiation, Harvard Law School , September 9, 2019, https://www.pon.harvard.edu/daily/dealmaking-daily/dealmaking-negotiations-how-to-build-trust-at-the-bargaining-table/ ; Ilana Zohar, “ ‘The Art of Negotiation’: Leadership Skills Required for Negotiation in Time of Crisis,” Procedia - Social and Behavioral Sciences 209 (July 2015): 542.
    其作用在于建立融洽关系：PON 工作人员，“谈判技巧：学习如何在谈判桌上建立信任”，哈佛大学法学院谈判项目，2019 年 9 月 9 日，https://www.pon.harvard.edu/daily/dealmaking-daily/dealmaking-negotiations-how-to-build-trust-at-the-bargaining-table/；Ilana Zohar，“‘谈判的艺术’：危机时期谈判所需的领导技能”，《程序 - 社会与行为科学》209（2015 年 7 月）：542。
  • how critical feelings are to unlocking conflict: Alison Wood Brooks, “Emotion and the Art of Negotiation,” Harvard Business Review , December 2015, https://hbr.org/2015/12/emotion-and-the-art-of-negotiation?referral=00060 .
    情感对于化解冲突至关重要：Alison Wood Brooks，“情感与谈判的艺术”，《哈佛商业评论》，2015 年 12 月，https://hbr.org/2015/12/emotion-and-the-art-of-negotiation?referral=00060。

Nine: How Have You Handled This Successfully in the Past?

九：你过去是如何成功处理这类事情的？

  • expand our pie of potential options: Paul E. Smaldino & Peter J. Richerson, “The Origins of Options,” Frontiers in Neuroscience , April 11, 2012, https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fnins.2012.00050/full .
    扩大我们潜在选择的范围：Paul E. Smaldino 和 Peter J. Richerson，“选择的起源”，神经科学前沿，2012 年 4 月 11 日，https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fnins.2012.00050/full。
  • memory influences how we make decisions: Ibid.
    记忆影响我们的决策方式：同上。
  • influence our sense of motivation and empowerment: Joris Lammers, David Dubois, Derek D. Rucker & Adam D. Galinsky, “Power Gets the Job: Priming Power Improves Interview Outcomes,” Journal of Experimental Social Psychology 49, no. 4 (2013): 778.
    影响我们的动机和赋权感：Joris Lammers、David Dubois、Derek D. Rucker 和 Adam D. Galinsky，“权力获得工作：启动权力改善面试结果”，《实验社会心理学杂志》49，第 4 期（2013 年）：778。
  • research has shown to improve: Ibid.
    研究表明有所改善：同上。
  • remember concrete strategies that might help: Smaldino & Richerson, “The Origins of Options.”
    记住一些可能有帮助的具体策略：Smaldino & Richerson，“期权的起源”。
  • “power priming”: Lammers, Dubois, Rucker & Galinsky, “Power Gets the Job: Priming Power Improves Interview Outcomes,” Journal of Experimental Social Psychology 49, no. 4 (2013): 778.
    “权力启动”：Lammers、Dubois、Rucker 和 Galinsky，“权力带来工作：权力启动改善面试结果”，《实验社会心理学杂志》49，第 4 期（2013 年）：778。
  • “coax[ing] ourselves into feeling more or less powerful”: “Business School Professor Explores the Effects of Power,” Columbia News , June 28, 2013, https://news.columbia.edu/news/business-school-professor-explores-effects-power .
    “诱导自己感觉更强大或更弱”：“商学院教授探索权力的影响”，哥伦比亚新闻，2013 年 6 月 28 日，https://news.columbia.edu/news/business-school-professor-explores-effects-power。
  • Hundreds of studies have shown: Ibid.
    数百项研究表明：同上。
  • can produce the same effects as actually having power: Pamela K. Smith & Yaacov Trope, “You Focus on the Forest When You’re in Charge of the Trees: Power Priming and Abstract Information Processing,” Journal of Personality and Social Psychology 90, no. 4 (2006): 580 (“Priming power should function in the same manner as actually experiencing it. Like any other concept, power is linked in memory to a host of characteristics and behavioral tendencies.”).
    可以产生与实际拥有权力相同的效果：Pamela K. Smith 和 Yaacov Trope，“当你掌控树木时，你会关注整片森林：权力启动和抽象信息处理”，《人格与社会心理学杂志》90，第 4 期（2006 年）：580（“权力启动的作用方式应该与实际体验权力的方式相同。像任何其他概念一样，权力在记忆中与一系列特征和行为倾向联系在一起。”）。
  • like in negotiation: Alain P.C.I. Hong & Per J. van der Wijst, “Women in Negotiation: Effects of Gender and Power on Negotiation Behavior,” Negotiation and Conflict Management Research, International Association for Conflict Management 6, no. 4 (2013): 281.
    例如在谈判中：Alain P.C.I. Hong 和 Per J. van der Wijst，“女性在谈判中的作用：性别和权力对谈判行为的影响”，谈判与冲突管理研究，国际冲突管理协会 6，第 4 期（2013 年）：281。
  • more likely to perform better: PON Staff, “Power in Negotiation: The Impact on Negotiators and the Negotiation Process,” Program on Negotiation, Harvard Law School , July 25, 2019, https://www.pon.harvard.edu/daily/negotiation-skills-daily/how-power-affects-negotiators/ .
    更有可能表现得更好：PON 工作人员，“谈判中的权力：对谈判者和谈判过程的影响”，哈佛大学法学院谈判项目，2019 年 7 月 25 日，https://www.pon.harvard.edu/daily/negotiation-skills-daily/how-power-affects-negotiators/。

Ten: What’s the First Step?

十：第一步是什么？

  • David Greenwald led his firm—Fried, Frank: Meghan Tribe, “Fried Frank Keeps Up Growth, Doubling Partner Profits over Five-Year Span,” The American Lawyer , March 21, 2019, https://www.law.com/americanlawyer/2019/03/21/fried-frank-keeps-up-growth-doubling-partner-profits-over-five-year-span/ .
    David Greenwald 领导他的公司——Fried, Frank: Meghan Tribe, “Fried Frank Keeps Up Growth, Doubling Partner Profits over Five-Year Span,” The American Lawyer, March 21, 2019, https://www.law.com/americanlawyer/2019/03/21/fried-frank-keeps-up-growth-doubling-partner-profits-over-five-year-span/.
  • he found a number of pressing issues: Leigh McMullan Abramson, “Top Goldman Lawyer Helped Turn Around a Struggling Law Firm,” Big Law Business , July 15, 2016, https://biglawbusiness.com/top-goldman-lawyer-helped-turn-around-a-struggling-law-firm .
    他发现了一些紧迫的问题：Leigh McMullan Abramson，“高盛顶级律师帮助一家陷入困境的律师事务所扭亏为盈”，《大律师事务所商业》，2016 年 7 月 15 日，https://biglawbusiness.com/top-goldman-lawyer-helped-turn-around-a-struggling-law-firm。
  • comprise the majority of the firm’s lawyers: “The Responsibility Factor, AKA the Partner-Associate Ratio,” Chambers Associate, October 10, 2019, https://www.chambers-associate.com/law-firms/partner-associate-leverage .
    占公司律师总数的多数：“责任因素，又称合伙人-律师比例”，Chambers Associate，2019 年 10 月 10 日，https://www.chambers-associate.com/law-firms/partner-associate-leverage。
  • ranks the nation’s biggest law firms: “Surveys & Rankings,” The American Lawyer , October 10, 2019, https://www.law.com/americanlawyer/rankings/ .
    对全国最大的律师事务所进行排名：“调查与排名”，《美国律师》，2019 年 10 月 10 日，https://www.law.com/americanlawyer/rankings/。
  • satisfaction of their mid-level associates: ALM Staff, “Which Firms Keep Midlevel Associates Happiest? The 2019 National Rankings,” The American Lawyer , August 26, 2019, https://www.law.com/americanlawyer/2019/08/26/where-are-midlevel-associates-happiest-the-2019-national-rankings/.overall .
    中层律师的满意度：ALM Staff，“哪些律所的中层律师最快乐？2019 年全国排名”，《美国律师》，2019 年 8 月 26 日，https://www.law.com/americanlawyer/2019/08/26/where-are-midlevel-associates-happiest-the-2019-national-rankings/.overall。
  • satisfaction ranking takes into account: Ibid.
    满意度排名考虑了以下因素：同上。
  • Fried Frank’s associate satisfaction ranking was 132: “The 2013 Associate Survey: National Rankings,” The American Lawyer , September 1, 2013, https://www.law.com/americanlawyer/almID/1202614824184/ .
    Fried Frank 的律师助理满意度排名为 132：“2013 年律师助理调查：全国排名”，《美国律师》，2013 年 9 月 1 日，https://www.law.com/americanlawyer/almID/1202614824184/。
  • law firms generally have a lot of turnover: Sam Reisman, “Turnover High At Many Firms Despite Greater Pay, Benefits,” Law360 , October 18, 2017, https://www.law360.com/articles/975882/turnover-high-at-many-firms-despite-greater-pay-benefits .
    律师事务所的人员流动率通常很高：Sam Reisman，“尽管薪酬和福利更高，但许多律师事务所的人员流动率仍然很高”，Law360，2017 年 10 月 18 日，https://www.law360.com/articles/975882/turnover-high-at-many-firms-despite-greater-pay-benefits。
  • established twice-yearly town hall meetings: Dearbail Jordan, “How to Revive a Law Firm,” The Lawyer, December 5, 2016, https://www.friedfrank.com/files/PressHighlights/TL%20-%20Feature%20Fried%20Frank%20-%20reprint.pdf
    设立每年两次的市政厅会议：Dearbail Jordan，“如何重振律师事务所”，《律师》杂志，2016年12月5日，https://www.friedfrank.com/files/PressHighlights/TL%20-%20Feature%20Fried%20Frank%20-%20reprint.pdf
  • met regularly with a smaller associate committee: Ibid.
    定期与较小的副委员会会面：同上。
  • surveyed associates again: “The Best Places to Work,” The American Lawyer , August 24, 2015, https://www.law.com/americanlawyer/almID/1202735469012/ .
    再次对同事进行了调查：“最佳工作场所”，《美国律师》，2015 年 8 月 24 日，https://www.law.com/americanlawyer/almID/1202735469012/。
  • satisfaction ranking jumped: Ibid.
    满意度排名大幅提升：同上。
  • landing them at #8: MP McQueen, “Survey: Midlevel Associates are Happier Than Ever,” The American Lawyer , September 1, 2016, https://www.law.com/americanlawyer/almID/1202765213979/Survey-Midlevel-Associates-Are-Happier-Than-Ever/ .
    排名第 8 位：MP McQueen，“调查：中层律师比以往任何时候都更快乐”，《美国律师》，2016 年 9 月 1 日，https://www.law.com/americanlawyer/almID/1202765213979/Survey-Midlevel-Associates-Are-Happier-Than-Ever/。
  • financial results have turned around: Tribe, “Fried Frank Keeps Up Growth, Doubling Partner Profits over Five-Year Span.”
    财务业绩已扭转颓势：Tribe 报道称，“Fried Frank 持续增长，五年内合伙人利润翻了一番。”
  • passed the $3 million mark: Ibid.
    超过 300 万美元：同上。
  • people tend to reciprocate gestures in negotiation: Robert Cialdini, “The Six Principles of Successful Workplace Negotiation,” Controlled Environments, September 4, 2015.
    人们在谈判中往往会做出回应：罗伯特·西奥迪尼，《成功职场谈判的六项原则》，受控环境，2015 年 9 月 4 日。
  • you’re more likely to get them to do it: Ibid.
    你更有可能让他们这样做：同上。
  • sense of purpose, which makes them happier: Annie McKee, “The 3 Things You Need to Be Happy at Work,” Annie McKee , September 5, 2017, www.anniemckee.com/3-things-need-happy-work/ .
    使命感让他们更快乐：安妮·麦基，“让你在工作中感到快乐的 3 件事”，安妮·麦基，2017 年 9 月 5 日，www.anniemckee.com/3-things-need-happy-work/。
  • what Stanford psychologist Carol Dweck calls a “growth mind-set”: Carol S. Dweck, Mindset: The New Psychology of Success (New York: Random House, 2006), 7.
    斯坦福大学心理学家卡罗尔·德韦克称之为“成长型思维模式”：卡罗尔·S·德韦克，《思维模式：成功的新心理学》（纽约：兰登书屋，2006 年），第 7 页。
  • embarked on a study: Corinne Purtill, “Exactly How Many Bad Ideas Does It Take to Produce a Good One? One Scientist Tried to Find Out,” Quartz , Aug. 30, 2017, https://qz.com/1062945/the-value-of-bad-ideas-according-to-a-scientist/ .
    开展了一项研究：Corinne Purtill，“究竟需要多少个坏主意才能产生一个好主意？一位科学家试图找出答案”，Quartz，2017 年 8 月 30 日，https://qz.com/1062945/the-value-of-bad-ideas-according-to-a-scientist/。
  • had had a lot of success for a medical academic: Ibid.
    作为一名医学学者，他取得了很大的成功：同上。
  • many of his ideas failed: Ibid.
    他的许多想法都失败了：同上。
  • 75 percent of the 185 ideas he found: Ibid.
    他发现的 185 个想法中有 75%：同上。
  • only 2.7 percent of his ideas met his criteria: Ibid.
    他的想法中只有 2.7% 符合他的标准：同上。
  • “The issue here is to recognize”: Ibid.
    “这里的问题在于要认识到”：同上。
  • “You cannot tell initially”: Ibid.
    “一开始是看不出来的”：同上。
  • improves patient compliance with treatment: Kelly B. Haskard Zolnierek & M. Robin DiMatteo, Physician Communication and Patient Adherence to Treatment: A Meta-Analysis, Medical Care 47, no. 8 (August 2009): 826–834.
    提高患者对治疗的依从性：Kelly B. Haskard Zolnierek 和 M. Robin DiMatteo，《医生沟通与患者对治疗的依从性：一项荟萃分析》，《医疗保健》47，第 8 期（2009 年 8 月）：826–834。
  • “The medical profession is no longer”: Dhruv Khullar, “Teaching Doctors the Art of Negotiation,” New York Times , January 23, 2014, https://well.blogs.nytimes.com/2014/01/23/teaching-doctors-the-art-of-negotiation/ .
    “医疗行业不再是”：Dhruv Khullar，“教医生谈判的艺术”，《纽约时报》，2014 年 1 月 23 日，https://well.blogs.nytimes.com/2014/01/23/teaching-doctors-the-art-of-negotiation/。
  • “Rather, clinicians and patients deliberate”: Ibid.
    “相反，临床医生和患者会进行商议”：同上。
  • not only feel more satisfaction: Ibid.
    不仅感到更满意：同上。
  • asking the patient to participate in deciding the course of treatment: Floyd J. Fowler Jr., Carrie A. Levin & Karen R. Sepucha, “Informing and Involving Patients to Improve the Quality of Medical Decisions,” Health Affairs 30, no. 4 (2011): 699–700.
    要求患者参与决定治疗方案：Floyd J. Fowler Jr.、Carrie A. Levin 和 Karen R. Sepucha，“告知和让患者参与以提高医疗决策的质量”，《健康事务》30，第 4 期（2011 年）：699-700。
  • presenting the list of possible options to the patient: “Strategy 6I: Shared Decisionmaking,” A gency for Healthcare Research and Quality , October 2017, https://www.ahrq.gov/cahps/quality-improvement/improvement-guide/6-strategies-for-improving/communication/strategy6i-shared-decisionmaking.html#ref8 .
    向患者提供可能的选择清单：“策略 6I：共同决策”，医疗保健研究与质量署，2017 年 10 月，https://www.ahrq.gov/cahps/quality-improvement/improvement-guide/6-strategies-for-improving/communication/strategy6i-shared-decisionmaking.html#ref8。
  • increasing the patient’s adherence: Zolnierek & DiMatteo; National Business Coalition on Health, “NBCH Action Brief: Shared Decision Making,” Patient-Centered Primary Care Coalition, July 2012, https://www.pcpcc.org/sites/default/files/resources/NBCH_AB_DECISIONMAKING_C.pdf .
    提高患者的依从性：Zolnierek & DiMatteo；全国商业健康联盟，“NBCH 行动简报：共同决策”，以患者为中心的初级保健联盟，2012 年 7 月，https://www.pcpcc.org/sites/default/files/resources/NBCH_AB_DECISIONMAKING_C.pdf。
  • improves statistics while creating savings: Ibid; Elizabeth C. Devine & Thomas D. Cook, “A Meta-Analytic Analysis of Effects of Psychoeducational Interventions on Length of Postsurgical Hospital Stay,” Nursing Research 32, no. 5 (1983): 267.
    改善统计数据，同时节省成本：同上；Elizabeth C. Devine 和 Thomas D. Cook，“心理教育干预对术后住院时间的影响的元分析”，护理研究 32，第 5 期（1983 年）：267。
  • non-compliance with treatment is estimated to cost billions: Brian Fung, “The $289 Billion Cost of Medication Noncompliance, and What to Do About It,” The Atlantic , September 11, 2012, https://www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2012/09/the-289-billion-cost-of-medication-noncompliance-and-what-to-do-about-it/262222/ .
    不遵医嘱治疗估计会造成数十亿美元的损失：Brian Fung，“不遵医嘱用药造成的 2890 亿美元损失，以及如何应对”，《大西洋月刊》，2012 年 9 月 11 日，https://www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2012/09/the-289-billion-cost-of-medication-noncompliance-and-what-to-do-about-it/262222/。
  • feeling of connection with their coworkers: Annie McKee, How to Be Happy at Work: The Power of Purpose, Hope, and Friendship (Boston: Harvard Business Review Press, 2018), 9.
    与同事建立联系的感觉：Annie McKee，《如何在工作中获得快乐：目标、希望和友谊的力量》（波士顿：哈佛商业评论出版社，2018 年），第 9 页。
  • what leads to healthy personal relationships: Bhali Gill, “Empathy is Crucial to Any Personal or Professional Relationship—Here’s How to Cultivate It,” Forbes , November 17, 2017, https://www.forbes.com/sites/bhaligill/2017/11/17/empathy-is-crucial-to-any-personal-or-professional-relationship-heres-how-to-cultivate-it/#73b0f3ae7961 ; Masoumeh Tehrani-Javan, Sara Pashang & Maryam Mashayekh, “Investigating the Empathy Relationship and Interpersonal Relationships Quality Among Senior Managers,” Journal of Psychology & Behavioral Studies 4, no. 1 (2016): 17.
    什么能带来健康的人际关系：Bhali Gill，“同理心对任何个人或职业关系都至关重要——以下是如何培养它”，《福布斯》，2017 年 11 月 17 日，https://www.forbes.com/sites/bhaligill/2017/11/17/empathy-is-crucial-to-any-personal-or-professional-relationship-heres-how-to-cultivate-it/#73b0f3ae7961；Masoumeh Tehrani-Javan、Sara Pashang 和 Maryam Mashayekh，“调查高级管理人员的同理心关系和人际关系质量”，《心理学与行为研究杂志》4，第 1 期（2016 年）：17。
  • went to the Mayo Clinic for evaluation: Sharing Mayo Clinic, “After Back Surgery, Jamie Ruden’s on the Court Again and Looking to Help Others,” Mayo Clinic, July 31, 2019, https://sharing.mayoclinic.org/2019/07/31/after-back-surgery-jamie-rudens-on-the-court-again-and-looking-to-help-others/ .
    前往梅奥诊所进行评估：分享梅奥诊所，“背部手术后，杰米·鲁登重返赛场并希望帮助他人”，梅奥诊所，2019 年 7 月 31 日，https://sharing.mayoclinic.org/2019/07/31/after-back-surgery-jamie-rudens-on-the-court-again-and-looking-to-help-others/。
  • knew there were a couple of possible solutions: Ibid.
    我知道有几种可能的解决方案：同上。
  • The doctor asked the patient: Ibid.
    医生问病人：同上。
  • She felt that the conservative approach: Ibid.
    她认为保守的做法是：同上。
  • The doctor supported that choice: Ibid.
    医生支持这一选择：同上。
  • committed to working hard: Ibid.
    致力于努力工作：同上。
  • she later told the Mayo Clinic: Ibid.
    她后来告诉梅奥诊所：同上。
  • Jamie opted for the surgery: Ibid.
    杰米选择了手术：同上。
  • helped, but didn’t eliminate: Ibid.
    有所帮助，但并未消除：同上。
  • helped Jamie and her family: Ibid.
    帮助了杰米和她的家人：同上。
  • The surgery was successful: Ibid.
    手术很成功：同上。
  • group brainstorming: Alex Faickney Osborn, Principles and Procedures of Creative Writing (New York: Scribner, 1957), 228–229.
    小组头脑风暴：Alex Faickney Osborn，《创意写作的原则和程序》（纽约：Scribner，1957 年），第 228-229 页。
  • would produce the best, most innovative results: Ibid.
    会产生最好、最具创新性的结果：同上。
  • shows that group brainstorming often doesn’t work: Donald W. Taylor, Paul C. Berry & Clifford H. Block, “Does Group Participation When Using Brainstorming Facilitate or Inhibit Creative Thinking?,” Administrative Science Quarterly 3, no. 1 (June 1958): 43.
    这表明，小组头脑风暴往往不起作用：Donald W. Taylor、Paul C. Berry 和 Clifford H. Block，“小组参与头脑风暴是促进还是抑制创造性思维？”，《行政科学季刊》3，第 1 期（1958 年 6 月）：43。
  • Individual work that then gets honed in a group: Marvin D. Dunnette, John Campbell & Kay Jaastad, “The Effect of Group Participation on Brainstorming Effectiveness for 2 Industrial Samples,” Journal of Applied Psychology 47, no. 1 (1963): 36–37.
    个人工作在小组中得到完善：Marvin D. Dunnette、John Campbell 和 Kay Jaastad，“小组参与对 2 个工业样本头脑风暴有效性的影响”，《应用心理学杂志》47，第 1 期（1963 年）：36-37。

Bring It Home: Concluding Your Negotiation

谈判收尾：如何达成协议

  • aspirations are based on our needs: Andrea Kupfer Schneider, “Aspirations in Negotiations,” Marquette Law Review 87, no. 4 (2004): 676.
    愿望源于我们的需求：Andrea Kupfer Schneider，“谈判中的愿望”，《马凯特法律评论》87，第 4 期（2004 年）：676。
  • make sure your aspirations are justifiable: G. Richard Shell, Bargaining for Advantage: Negotiation Strategies for Reasonable People (New York: Viking, 1999), 30–34.
    确保你的愿望是合理的：G. Richard Shell，《谈判优势：理性人的谈判策略》（纽约：Viking，1999 年），第 30-34 页。
  • tie your asks to anything objective: Roger Fisher, William Ury & Bruce Patton, Getting to Yes: Negotiating Agreement Without Giving In (New York: Houghton Mifflin, 1991), 88.
    将你的要求与任何客观事物联系起来：罗杰·费舍尔、威廉·尤里和布鲁斯·帕顿，《谈判力：不让步也能达成协议》（纽约：霍顿·米夫林出版社，1991 年），第 88 页。
  • human beings are very loss-avoidant: Daniel Kahneman, Jack L. Knetsch & Richard H. Thaler, “Experimental Tests of the Endowment Effect and the Coase Theorem,” Journal of Political Economy 98, no. 6 (Dec. 1990): 1328.
    人类非常倾向于避免损失：丹尼尔·卡尼曼、杰克·L·克内奇和理查德·H·泰勒，“禀赋效应和科斯定理的实验检验”，《政治经济学杂志》98，第6期（1990年12月）：1328。

指数

A note about the index: The pages referenced in this index refer to the page numbers in the print edition. Clicking on a page number will take you to the ebook location that corresponds to the beginning of that page in the print edition. For a comprehensive list of locations of any word or phrase, use your reading system’s search function.

关于索引的说明：本索引中引用的页码对应于纸质版中的页码。点击页码即可跳转到电子书中与纸质版该页码对应的位置。如需查找任何单词或短语的完整位置列表，请使用阅读系统的搜索功能。
